intro: Tragia nepetifolia var. amblyodonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, alternate leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its leaves are narrow and sometimes lobed, while its stems are erect and branched. The species is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought conditions.
